Comment: Just before Amy Coney Barrett was formally nominated for the Supreme Court, I saw a video of one of her university presentations where she described that being judge requires courage and strong footing and character, because it's not about winning popularity contests, but enforcing the law as written, even when many people would hate it.  It was obvious to me that she was talking about necessity of overturning basic human rights that right wing radicals like her think are not protected by the constitution. But now, I appreciate her lesson, because what she said is now proven as holy truth.  You know what? It's crazy that only year ago, I was dreading over abortion being made illegal in half the states. But now I'm dreading about the solidly real possibility that America will irreversibly lose its very status of a constitutional republic and abortion will soon be the least of your worries.
